title: Re: Painting Thread
content:
Nice work!

I have three paintings. Painted over ten years ago (haven't painted since, nor have my skills improved). [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sick.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

content:

title: Re: Painting Thread
content: Heh, you paint in that same 16-colour style - so if you can have unlimited colours, why is his head still blue? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

title: Re: Painting Thread
content: I have a bad habit of not considering lighting at all before I paint something that puts immense focus on it.[center]<font color="MAROON">TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS</font>[/center]

title: Re: Painting Thread
content:
Weird, but nice. XD

My grandfather and uncles have painted tons of stuff, and my father somewhat too, but I myself don't paint. However, I do link you folks to an awesome Lion King wall painting that's on my bedroom wall that my father and uncle painted:

[url=http://www.deviantart.com/deviation/31224742/?qo=7&q=by%3Adavince21&qh=sort%3Atime+-in%3Ascraps]www.deviantart.com/deviat...n%3Ascraps[/url]

Even though I am an ordinary man.
